title: Grammar & Vocabulary Round-Up - Part 1
description: Ejercicio comprehensivo que cubre vocabulario, phrasal verbs, reported speech y estructuras condicionales. Perfecto para repasar múltiples temas de nivel B1-B2.

questions.question: The chef needs to ________ the soup before serving it to check if it needs more salt.

answerOptions.rationale: 'Taste' is the correct verb for checking the flavor of food.
While you can smell food, 'taste' is more appropriate for checking seasoning.
'Touch' is not appropriate for checking food flavor.
'Hear' has nothing to do with checking food flavor.

questions.hint: Think about what action you do to check if food needs more seasoning.

questions.question: Complete the reported speech transformation:
questionParts: Sarah said: 'I will finish the project tomorrow.' → Sarah said that she
questions.hint: Remember: 'will' changes to 'would' in reported speech, and 'tomorrow' becomes 'the following day'.

questions.question: If I ________ more money, I ________ around the world.

answerOptions.rationale: This is the correct second conditional structure: If + past simple, would + base verb.
This is first conditional, not appropriate for hypothetical situations.
Mixed conditional forms are incorrect here.
This is third conditional structure, not second.

questions.hint: This is a hypothetical situation (second conditional).

questions.question: Complete the wish sentence:
questionParts: I don't speak French, but I'm going to Paris next month. I wish I
questions.hint: Use 'wish + could + base verb' to express a desired ability.

questions.question: The band's new ________ includes twelve songs and will be released next month.

answerOptions.rationale: An 'album' is a collection of songs released together.
A 'track' is a single song, not a collection.
A 'studio' is a place where music is recorded.
A 'concert' is a live performance, not a recorded collection.

questions.hint: Think about what contains multiple songs that are sold together.

questions.question: Transform to reported speech:
questionParts: 'Don't forget to buy milk,' my mother said. → My mother
questions.hint: Negative imperatives in reported speech use 'told + person + not to + verb'.

questions.question: Could you turn ________ the music? It's too loud and I can't concentrate.

answerOptions.rationale: 'Turn down' means to reduce the volume.
'Turn up' means to increase the volume.
'Turn off' means to stop completely, but the speaker just wants it quieter.
'Turn on' means to start, but the music is already playing.

questions.hint: The music is too loud, so what action would make it better for concentration?

questions.question: The lion stalked its ________ through the tall grass before attacking.

answerOptions.rationale: 'Prey' refers to animals that are hunted by predators.
A 'predator' is the hunter, not the hunted.
A 'pack' is a group of animals, not something being hunted.
A 'habitat' is a living environment, not something being hunted.

questions.question: Complete the wish sentence about a past regret:
questionParts: I didn't study enough for the test. I wish I
questions.hint: For past regrets, use 'wish + had + past participle'.
